attributes.action: require the Chancellor of the Exchequer to have passed a Tax Exam that is part of a recognised body of Accountant's exam offering.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Chartered Accountants in England and Wales must sit a tax exam as part of their ACA qualification, in which they are tested on personal and corporation tax.  These rules have been created and amended by various Chancellors.  

This petition urges the Prime Minister to create and enforce a law that requires any Chancellor of the Exchequer to have sat and passed this exam (or similar exam offered by a registered body of Accountants) prior to taking the Cabinet post.  

This would mean that the Chancellor has a micro-economic view of the impact of  the budget, as well as an overview of the macro-economic changes.  It may also result in a simpler tax system, reducing administration costs for individuals and businesses.

It seems peculiar that the individual who sets our taxes is in no way qualified to prepare a tax return.  This petition, in short, urges the Prime Minister to ensure that the Chancellor is fully qualified to understand the impact of the Budget.
